1151121.content:
Sayla awoke that morning with a loud yawn, her thin canine teeth glistening in the morning light. The female kitsune unwrapped her nine tails from around herself and stretched to greet the sun.

A pain from her flat belly told her that it was time for breakfast. Sayla reached over to the small tin box that she kept on a small shelf in the cave she lived in.

It was a cave, but it was not the typical dark and dank version most people were familiar with. Instead, the flooring and the walls were covered with a magically cultivated moss that acted like carpet, and there were large orbs that functioned as lights.

"Damn," Sayla was disappointed to see that her box was empty,"oh that's right; I ate the last one for dinner last night." Another growl of protest from her abdomin.

Sayal stood up and moved to the mouth of the cave, "Well," she said licking her lips," there IS a city near here within an brief walk. I'll just go restock."

The nearby city had been her supply of food for the last couple of months; Sayla was very good at finding ways to discreetly make a few residents vanish here and there without causing suspicion; and contrary to what one might think of her size, a kitsune only needed a little bit of food to be satiated, though many still enjoyed a hearty feast.

Still, Sayla longed to just go for a rampage within the city limits, tear houses apart and snatch her prey from within. There were many other cities, she thought, no one would miss one.

But she reminded herself that other kitsunes might be staking them out, and wouldn't appreciate her hunting in their territory.

The boy had blonde hair and black eyes... strange... Sayla never seen a human like that before... but since he wasnt running away, she opened her mouth and got ready to eat him!

1211.content:
Richard is a human boy who is 13. His hair is blond and his eyes are green. He is 5' 11". He's been told by many that the furs and scalies moving into neighborhoods are the enemy. They are outcast. Richard himself is an outcast. He has one secret that he's been keeping for a long time.
That secret is. . .
1211.title: Richard the Human Prey

12111.content:
His close friend is a furry type that has been with him since childhood. A unique type...

Her name is Rei Malison. A rare type of furry with reddish skin, long white hair, red pupils, rabbit-like ears, sharp wolf-like fangs, and a long black tail. It is still unknown what type of creature she is... but she is a predator and could be QUITE a threat to Richard's kind!

However, Richard never seemed to mind what she is. She was always kind to him, he was always kind to her. Although they both ate completely different types of food (CERTAIN food) Rei and Richard were inseparable!
------------------------------------------------------
Richard meets up with his best friend in an abandon junkyard...

"Is there something wrong Rich?" Rei asks him.

"Um...word is that there are gonna be more furs and scalies moving into our neighborhood," he tells him.

"Well, isnt that great? That means we wont have to hide anymore!" she says with a smile.

Richard just shakes his head, "Ive been told these people are enemies to my kind. We are.... prey to them. Well....humans are."

"Not to worry!" she says with a smile, "I'll protect you! You'll be safe with me!"

Richard gets a little nervous, "But um... the thing is... uh... Im well... afraid... that..."

She interrupts him, "Afraid that I'll eat you?"

"...yeah..."

Rei sighs, "C'mon! We've been friends since we were little! You know Id never turn on you like that! ....besides, if I wanted to eat you... Id have done it LOOOONNNNGG ago!!" She grins!

He laughs, "Heheh! Yeah, youre right! Im sorry, what was I thinking?!"

....however, unbeknownst to Richard, Rei DID have thoughts about it... but would she dare try?!
12111.title: Love is blind...and ambitious

121112.content:
Both Richard and Rei have a little laugh. He then tickles her cute lil rabbit-like ears. She purrs and rubs against his cheek... They both lock eyes for a moment... such a CUUUUUTTTEE couple, for a couple of different species...! It's just a shame that...

"The day of reckoning is upon us!! The sooner we repent for our sins, the sooner will we be spared his wrath!"

Huh? Whats that? They turn their heads... they see a young preacher (probably about 16 years old) with red hair and blood-red eyes! He looked human...but...something was different about him...

He spoke in an eerie accent, "The final judgement will soon ammense! We are all going to die!"

He headed toward Richard and Rei and said, "Our kind is not long for this world... we will soon die.."

He then looked at Richard with a wicked grin... and Richard could hear a voice in his head that sounded like the preacher:

"Especially you, human... being in the heart of your lover makes no difference... when youre in the STOMACH of her!!"

WHAT?!! Did he just....

The preacher then bows his head and walks off...

Richard thinks to himself, "Who...who was that man?"

"Um...Rich? Are you allright?" Rei looks at him concerned..

"Uh....yeah, yeah Im fine!" Richard tells her, although deep down... he's a little worried.

Would she.....?

Sadly enough, she had thoughts about it... but...

"Aw c'mon! Forget about that whacko! Let's go find some food! Im hungry! Are you hungry?" she asks
him smiling.

"Yeah, sure! Lets go!" Richard cheers up a bit..., "But uh...promise you wont eat another living dog in front of me again! You KNOW how that creeps me out!!!"

She giggles, "Ok! I promise!"

Where do they start looking?
121112.title: The wicked preacher

choices: Drop another quarter in his cup!
Forget about that creep! Go chase after Rei!
1211121.content:
Rich and Rei decided to look for food behind a dark alley... even if they bumped into something terrifying, it'd be no match for Rei! Her kind is considered a predator to nearly EVERY species on earth... but what IS she?!

Luckily, they didnt run into any trouble... the back-alleys were cleared except for the rats running around...

Richard was lucky enough to find a hundred dollar bill lying on the ground! He immediately went and bought a burger with fries and a drink! He offered to buy Rei something... but she perferred her food LIVING! She just ate a couple of the rats running around!

"Geez, I STILL cant believe how lucky I was finding a hundred on the ground! What are the odds?" Richard says excited.

"Nice!" Rei says smiling, "So what's next for us? Race up the mountains? Go fishing by the lake? Take a swim down by river? Huh? Huh?"

"Umm...let's just watch the stars, maybe at the top of that hill" Richard points at a hill.

"Cool! Race ya there!" Rei quickly dashes off!

Richard's about to run after her...but he turns his head and notices a young beggar lying in a corner. He's wearing sunglasses, tattered clothes, and has a cup in one hand and a sign reading "Tell Your Fortune- Only One Quarter!" in the other!

Since he's got plenty of money left to spare, he figures 'what the hey' and drops a quarter in the cup...

The beggar speaks...in a familiar accent:

"You have no future... your girlfriend will see to that! You are simply food to her... just like all of us. The Kahn's reign will soon be no more! HER kind will wipe out every last one of us!"

That voice... the same as the young preacher!!

Richard flips out, "WHAT?! What the hell are you talking about?!"

The beggar grins and says, "Drop another quarter and I'll tell you more..."
1211121.title: Glimpse of the Future

Richard just shakes his head and turns back around to go chase after Rei...

"ooowwwww...OOWWWWWW...aaugghh..." she groans with her hand on her cheek...

12112.title: Kagen Khan?

choices: Kagen is ambushed along the way by some furs(True Storyline)
Kagen reaches the Palace safely(Alternate Storyline)
121121.content:
"Yes uncle, the suspects are recieving trial as we speak for the murder of my comrade, Commander Zeshix." Kagen said bowing before his uncle Rubik, who sat in the throne, stroking fingers through his long gray beard. His uncle was rather pale and old looking, but he was a tall man, standing at 6'4", with a slightly chubby stomach.
"Excellent job my nephew, I'm quite proud of your efforts to capture the murderers of Zeshix...he was our best commander in the Khanate Guard, the only one better then you, if I recall correctly...I guess this means you inherit his place as the Supreme Khanate Commander..." Rubik said.
"Yes, uncle Rubik, my Khan, I accept this position with honor and will due to my best to use it responsibly." Kagen said.
"Very good, you are dismissed." Rubik said. Kagen nodded, walking out of the throne room.
Kagen threw a cloak over himself as he walked through the streets after he left the palace of Khanate City, the capital of the world. He entered an alley, and knocked on a brick wall. A brick pulled back and two eyes peered out at him.
"Password?" a dark voice said.
"12312315." Kagen said.
"Correct." the voice said, closing the eyehole, and the brick wall pulled back, revealing a thin passage with a staircase at the other end. Kagen walked in and descended, walking into a subterranean room.
"Greetings, my Khan." a man with a cybernetic arm who was bald said bowing to Kagen, who removed his cloak.
"Hello General Garshin, how goes the retirement?" Kagen said with a chuckle.
"In the words of the commoner, it sucks ass!" Garshin said. "But once you succeed, I can enjoy another 20 years of command in the army!"
Kagen nodded. "Yes, of course, you've picked the right side, Garshin." Kagen walked over and sat down at a table. At the table was a large black dragon, 11 feet tall, a man eater. His forked tongue slid out.
"Greetings Commander Draco." Kagen said. Draco nodded, quickly replying.
"We are gathered here today..." Kagen said removing his cloak, his pale face being revealed, "to discuss the plans of the transfer of authority that will occur in about 9 months. The first stage, eliminating our top rival, Zeshix, is complete. I have framed a few of his guards with his murder."
Several applauds were heard.
"Now...who is here? Anthro Commander Draco...Infantry Commander Mazumo?" Kagen glanced at the "Desert Tiger" Commander Mazumo, an anthro tiger who had served Rubik greatly in the Desert Rebellion. "Armor Division Commander Erwik?" He glanced at a commander who wore metal armor on much of his body, the head of the tank divisions.
"And last but not least, General Garshin. Now, our only main opposition is the head of the Khan's Guard, Commander Javil, and the Airforce Commander, Commander Heliek."
After some conversation, Kagen shared his plans.
"Now my noble allies, our plan is simple. Much of the Khanate Guard supports us. They want me to take power from my uncle and bring the Western Continents(North and South America in the current day) under the full control from the East once more! Rubik is a fool, he gave them almost full independence and only held a few major cities over there. All they had to do to agree was swear allegiance to the Khanate!" Kagen said.
"On New Year's Eve, 2315, we will attack my uncle Rubik while he is outside during the ceremony. We will ambush his private guards before the ceremony and replace them with our own. As Rubik is about to proclaim a new year of his rule, we ambush him, and assume power. Then the other details can be made clear, as the world will be ours...as well as the colonies on Mars, the Moon and Phobos, but that's not important."
After the meeting was concluded, Kagen smiled evilly as he began his trek towards the Palace.

The big bear fuzzy looks over the descriptions of the 2 defenses, and thens says "Well, I suspect neither is going to work all that well, but if I were you, I'd try the Doze instead of Spit-Out."

"The big problem in both cases is that there really isn't much difference between fuzzy and human."

"But..." Julie starts to interrupt.

But the fuzzy continues "I know, we can look really different, but the most different of us still has a lot of human in them. You'll be in college before you really need to worry about the details, but you change a couple of genes, add in the animal you want, do a bit of tweaking, and your human becomes a fuzzy.
"So that means that just about anything that hurts a fuzzy will hurt a human too. There are exceptions all over the map, but that is the way to bet. This purge will be harder on you than on the fussy who eats you. It likely will get you out of the stomach, but if it does, you will be so sick that you will wish had killed you, and it might do that.
"Now the Doze. That could backfire pretty easily too. You could end up sleeping until you were fully digested. But we fuzzies are rather prone to sleeping off a good meal anyway. So there's a good chance a doze of this will put us out while leaving you only a little sleepy.
"I'd slather this Doze all over while in the shower. If you wake up in the morning and are still in the shower, try something else. But if you can stand around for 5 or 10 minutes just feeling bored, take that shower, go to bed, and buy some for emergency use."

"Thanks, I'll try that."

"Fine, now off to study and play with Andrew."

Julie hurries up the stairs to find Andrew waiting.
121212212212111221222222221.title: save some money

1212122122121112212222222211.content:
Andrew is waiting for Julie, and has a D&D PC ready for her.

"Now this is a barbarian, an easy class for you to handle. About all you have to do is beat up things. And you do a good job of it. Sound good?"

"I suppose."

"OK, now you need to decide on race. We will be sticking to the standard stuff until you get your feet wet. So I would suggest a half-orc. The barbarian should be strong and tough and that is what a half-orc is. Rather stupid and ugly of course, but if you are good at one thing, you are bad at others. That sound good?"

Julie isn't sure of that, but she is not sure of anything at this point. Best to trust her "expert". "Sure"

"Now we decide on your stat points. They decide how strong, quick, smart you are. You want to to be strong and tough because that is what barbarians do. So we put a lot of points into Strength and Constitution. We also put some into Dexterity so you can dodge people who are trying to poke holes into you. That doesn't leave much for intelligence, wisdom, or charisma."

"Aren't wisdom and intelligence the same thing?"

"Not quite, tho the difference mostly is that is just how the game is played. We can get by for now by just saying your PC is neither."

"What's charisma? Does the low number there mean she is ugly?"

"Not necessarily. She likely is, but it means more that she just has a tendency to say or do the wrong thing."

"Gee, the poor kid. Can't I make that score higher?"

"If you want, but that means you will have to make something else worse."

"A girl needs social skills. I don't want her to be some sort of dwark."

"Ok, how about we put intelligence and wisdom at the minimum then? She is still not going to win any beauty contests, but she won't draw crude comments."

"Sounds good. Now what?"

We've got the important stuff. The rest is mostly details..."

Details it took a fair amount of time to cover of course, but still just details. It was eventually done. "Now she needs a name and you should think of a back story."

"Backstory?"

"Yes. The history of your character. She is 16 years old. What happened to her during those years. Why has she decided to start adventuring?"

"Gosh, I don't have any idea."

"So try to dream up an idea. What would cause you to leave home and risk life and limb?"

"That's going to take some thinking. And we have already used a lot of time. We only have enough left to go over my homework or for you to eat me." Strange how quickly things become normal. Not at all long ago, being eaten terrified her. Now it was on a par with doing her homework. Not that was exactly a prime desire of her's of course..
1212122122121112212222222211.title: PC

12121221221211122122222222112.content:
"We had best get our homework done."

Sigh...Andrew is such a nerd. Of course, it says something about how far Julie has come that she would literally rather be eaten alive instead of doing her homework.

Still, homework is not that bad when she has Andrew to explain it to her. Points that she would have had to agonize over become clear with his help, and he seems to know just what her hangup is, and she can then get the answer. Soon enough, she is done.

"well, thanks for the help. Sorry we didn't have time for eating...but, say, you did say you were interested in sports even if you can't play. Why don't I get you a seat on the sidelines to the next game?
12121221221211122122222222112.title: more homework

121212212212111221222222221121.content:
"That sounds great. I've never seen a game up close and personal. But how do I get in?"

"Well, you will this time." Julie assures him. "I can think of 2 ways to get you in. You can be part of the cheerleader squad. We can always use more lifters and you have the muscle for that. Or you can be part of the grunt workers. Always a lot of stuff that needs moving and carrying."

"Hmm...I guess..."
121212212212111221222222221121.title: ways to the game

1212122122121112212222222211211.content:
"I think you would enjoy the cheerleading" Julie encourages.

"Ok, I can give it a try."

"Good, we have practice in the morning, and can go to the D&D game in the afternoon. See you, and thanks for the help with my homework."

This time she arrives home on time, and without fuss from her parents. So her only problem is to consider her D&D character. Why would she be adventuring? Maybe she is trying to find her missing boyfriend? That sounds nice. But what are their names?
1212122122121112212222222211211.title: Rah, rah, rah

12121221221211122122222222112111.content:
Heloise and Abelard ... The famous lovers... Yes, naming her PC after the girl in the story is quite appealing. That settled, Julie is off to bed and a pleasant night's sleep.

Which is just as well since the cheerleader practice does not start out pleasantly.

"A fuzzy? What are you trying to do? Get half the squad eaten?

"Andrew has neve...he can't...er. I mean he would never eat any of you!" Julie rather hopes the others were not listening too closely to what she almost said.

It seems they are not picking up on the point. Instead it's "Yeah, right. Besides, what is he supposed to do?"

"Well, we can always use more lifters. He's got lots of muscle and we can manage some pretty wild stunts with his assistance.
"But if this fuzzy thing really bothers, we can make him an animal mascot and he can do some clowning."
12121221221211122122222222112111.title: Cheering practice

121212212212111221222222221121111.content:
They can't really keep a fuzzy off the squad, at least not easily. And if the stories they have heard are true, failing at keeping the fuzzy off the squad would be very dangerous. So it is best to put up with it, especially if it can actually be useful...

"Well, another lifter would be useful..." Indeed so. A good half the stunts they would do require someone to lift or carry another, and to accept that the one lifted got all the cheers. Hmm... maybe this fuzzy could be quite useful with the grunt work...

"Good." Julie agrees as she turns to the fuzzy. "Andrew, can you lift Payton, Amber, and me?"

"Huh, oh sure." Collectively the girls are quite a load for a human, but for all the muscles of a bear, Andrew expects to have little problem.

"OK, get down so we can climb on...Now get back up and .... abort!" Carrying the weight of the girls is, as expected, no serious problem, but there is the problem of balance. Get the center of gravity a little off center and ... gravity takes over and Andrew comes crashing down. The girls, all used to stunts going wrong, jump off with no problems, but Andrew lands rather heavily, to some unkind remarks from the rest of the squad.

"Hmm, ... We had best work up to 3 girls. This time, try it with just me..." Andrew is quickly able to handle this, and Payton is added to the program, successfully on the 2nd try.
But the addition of Amber takes quite a bit more work. Surprisingly, Julie quickly identifies the problem. Andrew and Amber are focusing on each other rather than the job. Amber deems him cute and Andrew is thinking that she smells delicious.

Less than a week ago, Julie would have been trying to insist there was nothing wrong with the relationship. After she was so bluntly shown the nature of the fuzzy, she would have been horrified that her best friend was so innocently putting herself in danger of becoming a warm spot in Andrew's belly. But now she finds herself jealous. Andrew is her's, and no hussy should be trying to steal him.
If she were a little more alert, she might be pleased. In some way Andrew had passed a test that made him allowable boyfriend material, a test neither had realized he was taking and that Julie has only a vague idea of what standards she used. But she doesn't need to know the standards, only the result. And that is that she likes Andrew, and in ways her parents would not approve of.
For now tho, she must forget the emotions, and tell the 2 of them to pay attention to the job at hand. And that is enough to get them working on the same wavelength, and the stunt comes together. The result is not spectacular, but definitely a good addition to their program. And now that Andrew is accepted, she should be able to create some really great stunts...

But as practice breaks up, Julie doesn't like the way Andrew is eying Amber. He is just looking too hungry. He had better get something in his belly before he starts thinking of misbehaving... Not that Andrew would actually eat Amber, but just the same it is best to eliminate the urge...
"Andrew, you could use a snack. Go thru that door over there and I'll be with you in a minute..."
It of course takes more like 5 minutes to deal with this and that, but eventually she is alone with Andrew and stripping so he can eat her. Again she considers how quickly being eaten has changed from unthinkable horror to a routine chore. Nor does she worry about removing clothing in front of Andrew. Instead she gets undressed quickly and lifts a leg to put it into Andrew's waiting maw. All entirely calm as she is gulped down.
Well not entirely. Andrew's licking of her hips draws protests of course, but not the sort that will quickly stop him.
It is the opening and closing of the door that does.
Looking up, Julie has time to wonder how she would react if she were the one coming in and seeing clothes scattered around and her best friend naked with a boy, one that is eating her whole and alive to boot.
Amber standing there open mouthed in shock doesn't seem too bad...

But Julie needs to decide what to do herself.
121212212212111221222222221121111.title: successful practice

1212122122121112212222222211211112.content:
"Ah..hi Amber...er...I'm a bit busy at the moment. Can we talk in about 5 minutes? ...er...oh, everything's fine. No problems here..."
It sounds pretty lame even to Julie, but she hadn't expected to get caught like this. She really wishes she could have sounded real cool, but maybe she should be proud she got out anything that made sense. And she did get to show Amber she isn't naked. Not really anyway. Of course her prude of a mother would never let her wear this bikini, but it did cover some of her.

Amber tho is starting to recover "But he is eating you." Indeed, he had not stopped and and is now close to her chest.

"Right. Stay cool. He'll spit me out in a few minutes.."

Amber is less than fully convinced, but just watches in horrified fascination as the rest of Julie vanishes into Andrew. Then she asks the obvious, if perhaps silly, question of Andrew "Is she....?"

Julie answers "I'm fine. No problem a quick bath won't cure."

"Julie?"

"Sure. I'm just here in his belly. Come on up and feel if you like."

Getting within reach of this woman-eater? That sounds insane! But there is a certain fascination to finding out Julie is actually alright...
1212122122121112212222222211211112.title: finish her

choices: finds she is interested in vore
12121221221211122122222222112111122.content:
"Oh come on. He can't eat you. He's full" Julie isn't sure that it true or not. After all, a week ago, she would have been sure Andrew couldn't even eat her, and that had proven way wrong. So maybe he can chow down on 2, or even more, girls. But right now, Amber must be assured everything is safe, and if a lie is necessary... So when Andrew starts to make a comment that sound suspiciously like he is going to claim he can eat Amber too, Julie gives him a kick in the stomach wall. Given the muscle she hits, she really doubts she hurts him at all, but it seems to work well enough in stopping Andrew from talking long enough for her to jump in with a change of subject. "I'm only going to be in here a few minutes before I have to get out for a shower, so better hurry up."

Amber is still horrified, but can't stop herself from moving forward, very hesitantly, and then putting a hand on Andrew's huge belly. Julie is able to grasp it from her side. Not exactly a strong grip, indeed just barely enough for Amber to even realize something was trying to hold onto her. But with her state of nerves, quite enough to cause her to jerk back and take several scared steps away from Andrew.

"Now, now. No need to be nervous. I was just trying to shake hands. Give it another try." But Amber has had quite enough, and stays back. "Well, we got to get to the D&D game, so time to spit me out Andrew."
Andrew quickly deposits her on the floor, where Julie announces "Got to take a shower for sure. Back in 10 minutes.", grabs her clothes and heads to the showers.
Amber finds herself alone with Andrew and ...
12121221221211122122222222112111122.title: it's perfectly normal

121212212212111221222222221121111222.content:
As Julie leaves, Amber is thinking how sensible it would be for her to leave too. She should stay alone in a room with a carnivore able to eat her alive? leaving, at a high rate of speed, seems the only sensible idea.
But somehow she can't. There is something terribly fascinating about Andrew and this terrible vore ability. She recalls stories about how snakes can fascinate their prey, even causing them to feed themselves to the snake. She had always felt this was just a myth, but now she is no longer so sure of that. No matter how hard she reminds herself of the danger, she can't get herself to move away from Andrew. Maybe she can excuse herself as simply rigid with fright, but why is there this feeling that if he ordered her to approach, she would stuff herself in his mouth?

To break this spell, she tries asking Andrew about his vore ability. He responds with information, which Amber barely hears. Her mind continues to fill with terrifying pictures of Andrew grabbing her and shoving her into his maw. Terrifying, but somehow fascinating.
She greets Julie's return with relief [and disappointment?] And quickly promises to get together with Julie and Andrew in the future as she leaves. As she makes the promise, she realizes she means it. Her hope that she is escaping vanishes. That is terrifying, and attractive...

As the other girl vanishes, Julie lets out a sigh of relief. "That didn't go so bad."

"True", Andrew responds "But it is not over yet. She is too interested. I may end up eating her.

"You had better not!"

"It will make things a lot easier."

"You are just thinking with your stomach."

"maybe, but she is going to want to learn more, and why not show her everything by eating her?"

Julie can hardly say that she is starting to think of Andrew as boyfriend and vore as a distinctly personal act, one bordering on betrayal if he were to eat another girl, but it takes time to think of alternate reasons. "Well, we have time to consider the matter. Right now, we had best get to the D&D game."
121212212212111221222222221121111222.title: willing food?

1212122122121112212222222211211112222.content:
Amber has delayed Julie and Andrew a little, and the D&D game has started when they arrive. Julie, perhaps as the newcomer, and the only girl in sight, feels a bit intimidated. Not that the half dozen lads around the table look all that dangerous. In fact, they look rather quiet. Still, they are new, and they do look to vary a lot.

"Sorry to be late." Andrew announces.

"No problem." The fellow at the head of the table responds. "We are still in town and and can add you easily."
"Now Julie? I'm Frank, the DM."

"DM?"

"A real noob, eh. Well, DM is short for Dungeon Master. I tell you what the situation is, and you tell me what you do. Then I tell you the results of that. You get to react to that and I tell you what happens next, and so forth.
"Now right now, I need to know who you are."

"I'm Julie.."

"No, your PC. Name, class, race..."

"Ah...Heloise, ...barbarian, half-orc."

"OK, that makes it easy to fit you in. The party can just hire some muscle. Now why are you out adventuring?

"Ah, she is trying to find her missing boyfriend."

"Missing under what conditions? Ran off leaving her pregnant? Kidnapped? I'll probably put him into the game some way, so I need to know."

"I didn't think of that."

"Well, no rush about it, but I need to know soon."

"Hmm, I think it would be best if ...
1212122122121112212222222211211112222.title: starting the game

12121221221211122122222222112111122222.content:
"Well, I don't want anything to have happened yet. It's going to, but... [Is she talking about her character or herself? Or both?] Yeah, that sounds good. He vanished just before they were going to take things to another level. So of course she wants him back, but there is no clue about what happened to him."

"OK, I can work with that. You are here because you heard a rumor he might be in the area. You found the rumor was false, and needing money, you joined up with this gang in their plan to explore this old dungeon. Sound good?"

"OK"

"Fine. The lot of you head out to the dungeon. Place your figures on the mat in march order."

"And we get hit by the OTA.." says one of the boys at the table."

"OTA?"

"Obligatory Thug Attack. One of the cliches of the game is that we always get attacked by bandits, and our DM is not the most original."

"Well, I don't always have it first thing ... But yes, I did this time. Everybody roll their spot."

"Spot?"

Andrew explains "You roll a d20, higher the better, and then add your bonus to spot. That's this line here.. Hey DM, can she roll her listen instead?"

"Nope. By the time she gets close enough to hear, she will be too close."

"OK, roll"

"A 7. What does that mean?"

"That you are cheerfully walking along thinking about your boyfriend instead of the risk of the trail. You have no idea what is about to happen. What did the rest of you roll?"

Several apparently have rolled well, and the DM places several figures on the board and announces they are attacking. He calls for initiative rolls [This time, Julie rolls much higher].

"OK, surprise round. Heloise, you are surprised and don't act. Nor does ... 1st up is.."

The process is rather bewildering to Julie. The player or the DM announces what the character is doing, some dice are mysteriously rolled, and results are announced. Julie is confused as to what these results are, but from the atmosphere at the table, things are going well.

"OK, round 1. Thoral is up, and then Heloise." Another lad goes thru the ritual, and then it is her turn. "Andrew, what do I do?"

"Well, you can move 40', so you can move to here, and then attack that figure. Since you are a barbarian, you should rage 1st of course. That makes you more powerful, but easier to hit."

"OK, then?"

"Then roll that d20, and roll high"

"A 3? I suppose that is not good?"

"Correct. You move up to the bandit and swing and miss badly. The bandit is up next and swings back, not being a gentleman. 12 and your AC is ??

"Ah... 16."

"No, it's 14 because you raged."

"Which means he hits and you can kick Andrew for giving you bad advice. You take .."

Comparing her hp figure with the damage, Julie can see Heloise is hurt bad. "Ouch".

The battle continues. Presently a player moves his figure to the figure of Heloise and her foe. He rolls and announces "15+2 for flank, thanks Heloise, and .."

"Yup, that hits."

"And I do" pausing to roll several dice "14" damage."

"Hurts him, but he is still there."

The round continues. Julie notes that several figures get removed from the table. Apparently her side is doing well.

"Heloise, you are up."

"Oh, I attack again?"

"Right, roll."

"9? Will that hit?"

"Let's see. +1 BAB, +6 str, +2 for the flank. No, just misses."

"You forgot the +1 for bard song." Andrew puts in.

"Then you hit. Roll Damage."

"How do I do that?"

"Roll the d12 and add ... 10"

"8..+10 = 18"

"And he drops."

"I didn't kill him, did I?"

This produces considerable laughter, and suggestions of better classes for Julie in the future. But the DM assures her her victim is still alive, tho badly hurt.

The round continues, and the rest of the bandit figures are one by one pronounced defeated and removed. Victory is declared and someone asks "Who is hurt? And how much?"

"Well, I am, and so is this man I hurt."

"He attacked us, and he can take his chances."

"But we can't just let him die."

"We can, but if you want, I'll do a heal check...Made it. Ok, he is stable. Now I heal you and you can stand guard over the prisoner while we loot the bodies.

"OK, make a search roll, everybody."

Soon the DM is reading a document he says the party has found. Apparently it has meaning to the others, who regard it as reason to forget the dungeon and go somewhere else, after some enemy of their's she thinks. Anyway, the party is off in a new direction.

But then she is asked by the DM. "So what do you want to do with your prisoner?"

There are several suggestions, some deadly. Julie objects "But we can't just kill him."

Several assure her they certainly can. He attacked, and there is no convenient law to turn him in to. But they are willing to indulge her. They will leave him just tied up, or they can take him along if she wants to guard him.
12121221221211122122222222112111122222.title: 1st battle

121212212212111221222222221121111222222.content:
"I guess we had best keep him as a prisoner."

There are several dire warnings the thug will attack her in the night, but nobody is willing to stop her, and the thug agrees to be a porter.

The party then moves in a new direction. When Julie asks why, she is told the message is from an enemy of their's and tells of a chance for them to really give it to him, and make some good money at the same time.

The party travels for some time and again the DM calls for a spot check. This time, Julie makes the roll. The scene is described as a wagon under attack by several humans. When she is asked what what she is doing, she quickly says "I charge to attack".
there are several groans about this, mostly from those who want a more sneaky approach, but Julie merely asks "They need help, so why not get right to it?"
As the others try to explain the tactical position to her, the DM announces her charge fails to reach the enemy, and everyone is to roll for initiative. The battle is about to start..
121212212212111221222222221121111222222.title: new foe

1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.content:
When it is Julie's turn to act, she continues the charge and attacks one of the humans "..17 plus.."
"Hits" the DM confirms and after hearing the damage "Hurts him bad, but he is still up."

A moment later Julie finds out why charging out in front of the party is not a good idea. There are 4 foes around her surrounding her and trying to do her harm. "Three of them rolled 1?? Girl, you want to come with me next time I go to the racetrack?"

"I still took serious damage." Julie points out.

"You should be dead. Well, there is always next round."

However, Julie has friends who now reach the battle scene. They quickly reduce the odds, dropping 2 of her foes, and Julie's next roll removes the one she had wounded. "Told you it wasn't so bad."

"Not so fast. The last one swings at you and ...hits, and does ...10 damage."

"Oh dear, that's over my hit points. Am I dead?"

"Not yet, but you are down and dying unless the others finish rescuing you." They do, and the common call of "Cleric!" is answered with enough healing to get her back on her feet.
"That is why we don't split the party." one of the players admonish Julie.

After another combat, the party reaches a town and the DM points to the clock. "OK, that's it for today. I'll pass out gold and experience. Julie, you will be 2nd level next time, so you need to select another character level."

"What should I select?" she asks Andrew.

"Probably another level of barbarian, but there are alternatives. We will have to do some shopping too."

"Well, thanks for letting me play. I had a good time."
1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.title: battle

1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.content:
Saying she had enjoyed herself was the polite thing to do, but it was still a lie. As far as Julie was concerned, it had been boring and confusing. So much for this plan. She would have to find some other way to bond with Andrew.

"I'm glad you could play. I hope you continue." is andrew's comment.

"Oh? When is the next game?" Such is the role of the girlfriend, to be dragged into junk just to keep her relationship healthy. Still, maybe it will be better as she gets more experience with the game. But maybe it is working.

"Next Saturday."

"OK, it's a date. Now we have cheerleader practice tomorrow. You want to get in some study tonight? Or just have some chow?"
1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.title: not so bad after all

1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.content:
"Hmm... If I eat you, we can still do a little studying. I guess it won't be as full, but we can get a little of both."

"Ok, let's head to your place then."

Once in Andrew's room, Julie quickly strips. At least she tries to tell herself she is quickly stripping. To Andrew, it seems that the garments are removed at a speed more related to how much he enjoys their removal than to any difficulty in removing them. He enjoys the process quite a bit and is distinctly excited as Julie finishes and extends her legs for dining. As usual, she is quite tasty.

Julie, however, gets quite testy once she feels his tongue exploring forbidden territory. At first she isn't sure she should tell him to stop, but it quickly becomes clear he is not going to stop otherwise and however likely she will be ready for this soon, she is not yet, and Andrew gets a rap on the nose [learning, if not how to please a lady, at least that there are advantages to eating her head first.]

Surprisingly, the study goes rather well despite being in a dark belly. Much of her work can be recited from her memory and Andrew can correct her by checking the written text. Soon it is time to be spit out, take a shower and head home.

As she does, she starts to give Andrew a kiss, and then realizes what that will imply. For a moment, she draws back, fearful of that future, but it is the future she has chosen for herself, and she is not going to let simple fright get in her way. If she is ready, she should be Ready! And so Andrew gets a Kiss! [including a hug that would have strangled a mere human male] instead of a kiss. It leaves the lad too bewildered to do anything before she is out of the house.

Julie in the meantime is worrying about how many questions her family will ask. And about what to do about Amber.
1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.title: pleasant dining

1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.content:
As her family sits down to dinner, Julie finds herself under interrogation. She has been seeing a lot of this Andrew of late. What is going on? What is he like? What? ...

Fortunately they are merely bothersome questions rather than suspicious ones. More worried parents might wonder just why she keeps mentioning that she and he are always under escorted conditions when nobody is really asking that sort of question that often. Nor do they pick up that Andrew's description has a number of rather large gaps in it. Saying he is an honor student, plays chess and D&D, and uses his computer doesn't mention the physical side. Saying that he is bigger than her, but needs to grow a lot to match his father is correct, but a bit odd to say, unless you are trying not to say he is already bigger than most adult human males. Eventually, the meal, and the questions, comes to an end and she can escape to her room.

The next day is more cheerleader practice, and Julie is quite pleased at how well their routine is falling into place. They should make quite a show at the game. Less pleasing is the interaction between Andrew and Amber. She just can't seem to leave him alone. At times, she seems scared of him, but she seems drawn to him as well. Not a situation she at all approves of. He is her property. However, for the moment, she can only concentrate on the act, and has to wait until afterwards to deal with the situation.

Which turns out to be too late. "Amber wants to study with us tonight."

"But..." But what can she really say that is a valid excuse? Saying she wants to be alone with her boy means admitting he is her boy, which is altogether the wrong thing to tell any lad at this sort of point. So she is not alone as she enters Andrew's home this time.

As she says hi to Andrew's father, she hears a frantic gasping from Amber. Turning, she sees the lass has the wide, engrossed eyes of a horror show victim about to die messily. She can't take her eyes off the huge bear-man. Julie realizes she has almost forgotten what a sight he is.

"Well, well, you got your first meal here Andrew. And she looks to be fine dining too."

"Amber?"

"Yes, see how she looks, classic food."

"But you can't eat Amber!" Julie protests.

"Somebody's going to. She just can't stay away from furries that will eat her. Might as well be Andrew."

There is at least something to his claim. Amber is making no effort to flee out the still open door behind her, terrified as she looks. It will be up to Julie to save her, a task that might result in her being eaten too.
1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.title: Amber on the menu?

1212122122121112212222222211211112222222.content:
